Sequence Information.Peptide Name: CM6 (Ctriporin analog G4K,G8K,S11K,A12K,T14K,S15K, Lys-rich, synthetic AMPs, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (68.42%) toCtriporinK: 42%, I=L: 16%.Activity: active against S. aureus ATCC29213 or ATCC25923 MRSA (MIC 3.4 uM), E. faecium ATCC29212 (MIC 3.4 uM), E. coli ATCC25922 or ATCC35218 (MIC 3.4 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC27853 (MIC 1.7 uM), K. pneumoniae ATCC700603 (MIC 3.4 uM), A. baumannii ATCC19606 (MIC 1.7 uM).In vitro toxicity:  human RBC: HC50> 500 ug/ml. 20% hemolysis at 500 ug/ml, poor hemo.lytic.Structure:  random coil in water and helical in 30 mM SDS micelles.
Literature Information.Author: Luo X, Deng H, Ding L, Ye X, Sun F, Qin C, Chen Z.2024
Literature Information.Title: Cationicity Enhancement on the Hydrophilic Face of Ctriporin Significantly Reduces Its Hemolytic Activity and Improves the Antimicrobial Activity against Antibiotic-Resistant ESKAPE Pathogens.
